title: The $90 Billion Squeeze: What the Triad's Budget Really Means for Your Capture Strategy
description: Two massive funding streams are converging as the Pentagon tears up its acquisition rulebook. Here's what the 8(a) crackdown and the new lethality test mean for defense health contractors.

title: The MHS Triad Part 2: The Technology Stack
description: H2F, the telehealth landscape, what's missing in enterprise RPM, and specific guidance for contractors navigating the new MHS command structure.

title: The MHS Triad Part 1: Meet the Three Leaders Who Will Reshape Military Medicine
description: Keith Bass, Emil Michael, and Admiral Darin Via are about to transform the Military Health System. Here's what you need to know about the new command structure.

title: Department of War: What the Pentagon's Name Change Means for Health IT
description: The rebrand from Defense to War isn't just optics. It's doctrine. Here's how the shift to lethality metrics will reshape military health priorities.

title: The Audit Mandate: Why Everything Has to Work Now
description: DoD must achieve a clean audit by December 2028. Section 1002 gives leadership authority to fire SES employees for audit failures. Here's what that means for health IT.

title: The Oura Disaster: Lessons from a Failed $96M Sole-Source Contract
description: The wearables deal didn't die because of WHOOP's protest. It died because DHA couldn't audit the data. Here's what that means for your next proposal.

title: Human Performance Optimization: The Doctrine Behind the Tech
description: Admiral Via's 'Human Weapon System' concept is reshaping how the MHS thinks about warfighter health. H2F results prove the ROI. Here's the roadmap.

title: GenAI.mil: What Emil Michael's AI Push Means for Military Medicine
description: 3 million users, every classification level, right now. The Pentagon's CTO is betting big on AI. Here's how it intersects with DHA's 120+ AI projects.
